questionListItems.title: Where do I find more information pertaining to P1 matters?

answer.body:
Information pertaining to Primary 1 matters can be found via this link:
https://westwoodpri.moe.edu.sg/our-partners/2023-p1-parents

questionListItems.title: Does the school offer higher Mother Tongue languages?

answer.body:
• Since 2022, we have been offering Higher Mother Tongue Language from Primary 3 to Primary 6. This
allows more pupils to deepen their knowledge and appreciation for these languages and their cultures
from an early age.
• If your child is not taking Higher Mother Tongue language in P3, he/she can still consider this option at
the end of P4 due to subject-based banding. However, this is subjected to having strong interest and
good performance in the subject.

questionListItems.title:
If my child is not studying Higher Mother Tongue Language in P5, can he/she takes up the subject in
P6?

answer.body:
It is not recommended as the child has to catch up on the curriculum which he/she has missed in P5,
which may cause unnecessary academic stress for him/her.

questionListItems.title: Where do I find more information pertaining to Secondary school matters, such as DSA?

answer.body:
• Information pertaining to Secondary school matters can be found via this link:
https://www.westwoodpri.moe.edu.sg/others/sec-sch-matters/
• Information will be updated periodically.

questionListItems.title: Will Secondary Schools have open house for parents and pupils to visit?

answer.body:
• Information pertaining to Secondary open-house can be found via this link:
https://www.westwoodpri.moe.edu.sg/others/sec-sch-matters
• Parents can refer to this link https://www.moe.gov.sg/schoolfinder to find and shortlist the Secondary
Schools which your child is interested.

questionListItems.title: What are the documents to submit for DSA?

answer.body:
Primary school information, such as academic results, CCA and VIA involvement, School-based
achievements will be shared with the secondary schools. Testimonials are not required. If the child has
other achievements beyond school, you can submit the scanned copies using the “Others” option field.

questionListItems.title: Based on the achievement levels, is 65 the new passing mark?

answer.body:
PSLE is a school placement examination, which allows students to customise their secondary
education by taking subjects at different levels according to their aptitude and strengths. Hence, there is
no passing mark for PSLE.

questionListItems.title: If my child did not study Higher Chinese, can he/she applies for SAP school?

answer.body:
Yes, however the child will be required to study HCL in the SAP school. During the S1 Posting Exercise,
the SAP school will decide whether the child is able to cope and he/she is a good fit for the school, with
regards to the adaption to HCL curriculum and the school’s culture.

questionListItems.title:
How to I check whether the calculator or Chinese electronic dictionary is an approved model for use
during PSLE?

answer.body:
For the list of approved calculators, please visit
https://www.seab.gov.sg/home/examinations/approved-calculators
• For the list of approved dictionaries, please visit
https://www.seab.gov.sg/home/examinations/approved-dictionaries

questionListItems.title: Will Lower Primary pupils have any exposure to CCAs?

answer.body:
In Westwood Primary, CCAs will commence from Primary 4. However, pupils will have the opportunity
to experience different types of sports, Visual and Performing Arts, etc. during their Physical Education
(PE), Art, Music and Programme for Active Learning (PAL) lessons.• For more information on CCA, please
refer to https://www.westwoodpri.moe.edu.sg/cca/.

As time and effort has been devoted in training and development of your child, we would strongly
discourage to change CCA. Kindly write in to our HOD CCA at khairul_abdillah_b_ismail@moe.edu.sg.

questionListItems.title: Will when my child starts CCA?

answer.body: CCA is compulsory only for P4 to P6 pupils.

questionListItems.title: When can my child become a prefect?

answer.body:
All pupils will be given a class leadership role to develop their leadership qualities. From P3 onwards,
pupils who are nominated to become prefects will undergo on-the-job training to further develop their
leadership competencies before they are officially appointed as prefects. You can refer to this link
https://www.westwoodpri.moe.edu.sg/departments/student-leadership for more information on our
Student Leadership Programme.

For the well-being of all pupils and parents, our school has adopted staggered dismissal timings as
follows:
- P1 at 1.20 pm
- P2 at 1.25 pm
- P3 to P6 at 1.30 pm

questionListItems.title: Where will my child be waiting during dismissal?

answer.body:
There are a few dismissal points and pupils will be dismissed according to the dismissal arrangement.
• To avoid confusion for our children and teachers, parents are strongly encouraged to adhere strictly to
the daily dismissal arrangements made. Should there be a need to make any changes, parents are to
inform the Form Teacher ahead of time via our General Office number at 6412 1690 and to collect a
approval slip which will be then presented to the Guards at the Exit gate.
• Only P4 to P6 pupils are allowed to go home on their own. If they need to fetch their younger siblings,
they can wait at the foyer. However, if they have after-school activities, parents will have to make the
necessary arrangement to fetch the younger siblings from school, via the front or back gate.
